text: Are there regular expression equivalents for searching and modifying tree structures?
Concise mini-languages (like perl regex) are what I am looking for.
Here is an example that might clarify what I am looking for.

code:
<root>
  <node name="1">
    subtrees ....
  </node>
  <node name="2">
    <node name="2.1">
     data
    </node>
    other subtrees...
  </node>
</root>

text:
An operation that would be possible on the above tree is "move subtree at node 2.1 into
the subtree at node 1.
" The result of the operation might look something like..

code:
<root>
  <node name="1">
    subtrees ....
    <node name="2.1">
     data
    </node>
  </node>
  <node name="2">
    other subtrees...
  </node>
</root>

text: Search and replace operations like find all nodes with atleast 2 children, find all nodes whose data starts with "a" and replace it with "b" if the subtrees have atleast 2 other siblings, etc.
For strings, where the only dimension is across the length of the string, we can do many of above operations (or their 1D equivalents) using regular expressions.
I wonder if there are equivalents for trees.
(instead of a single regex, you might need to write a set of transformation rules, but that is ok).
I would like to know if there is some simple mini language (not regex per.se, but something that is as accessible as regex via libraries, etc..).
